tooltip_tab_transcription: Configure the main transcription service (API, model, language, etc.).
tooltip_tab_rephrase: Set up automatic rephrasing or prompting of your transcribed text using a secondary AI model.
tooltip_tab_transformations: Define custom prompts for manual selection-based rephrasing / transformations.
tooltip_tab_general: General application settings like UI language, logging options, etc.
api_key_tooltip: Your API key for the selected service (e.g., OpenAI or Groq).
api_endpoint_tooltip: The API endpoint URL for the transcription service.
model_tooltip: The specific AI model to use for transcription.
temperature_tooltip: Controls randomness. Lower values (e.g., 0.0) make the output more deterministic. Higher values make it more creative.
hotkey_tooltip: The key combination to press to start/stop recording.
input_language_tooltip: The language of your speech. 'Detect Language' can work but specifying the language is more accurate.
gain_tooltip: Boosts your microphone volume if you are too quiet. 0 dB is no change. Positive values amplify.
transcription_prompt_tooltip: Provide hints to the AI to improve accuracy for specific words, names, or formatting.
liveprompt_enable_tooltip: Enables or disables the LivePrompting feature.
liveprompt_help_button_tooltip: Click for a detailed explanation of LivePrompting.
liveprompt_help_tooltip:
LivePrompting allows you to turn your voice directly into commands for the AI.

1. Set Trigger Words: Define one or more words (e.g., 'prompt', 'write', 'ask').
2. Speak: When you say a trigger word followed by an instruction (e.g., "prompt write a python function to sort a list"), the entire sentence is sent to the AI.
3. Result: The AI executes the instruction and types out the result.

This is different from Generic Rephrasing, which only reformats the text you spoke.
liveprompt_trigger_words_tooltip: One or more words (comma-separated) that, when spoken, will activate LivePrompting.
liveprompt_system_prompt_tooltip: The system instruction for the AI when LivePrompting is activated. Tells the AI how to behave.
generic_rephrase_enable_checkbox: Enable Generic Rephrasing (if liveprompting disabled OR no trigger word is found)
generic_rephrase_prompt_tooltip: The instruction for the AI when performing a generic rephrase (e.g., 'Make this sound more professional').
shared_api_group_tooltip: These API settings are used for all rephrasing and LivePrompting operations.
rephrase_context_checkbox: Add selected text as Context when LivePrompting via Triggerword
rephrase_context_tooltip:
If checked, any text you have selected on screen will be automatically added
as context to the prompt when a trigger word is used.
transformations_info: Define up to {max_entries} rewording Prompts for Post-Processing of Transcriptions.
restore_clipboard_checkbox: Restore Clipboard after use (If deactivated: Will copy transcript to clipboard)
debug_logging_checkbox: Activate Debug Logging (more details in log)
file_logging_checkbox: Write log file in application folder (WhisperTyper.log)
play_last_recording_tooltip: Play latest recording using the default system player
transcription_failed_message: Transcription failed. See dialog for details.
validation_warning_text: There seem to be some issues with your settings (warnings only / still saved):
quit_dialog_text: Are you sure you want to exit?
post_rephrase_hotkey_label: Hotkey to show post-rephrasing options for selected text:
post_rephrase_hotkey_tooltip: Press this hotkey while text is selected to show a menu with your custom transformations.
about_dialog_text:
WhisperTyper

A simple tool to transcribe your voice to text and rephrase it using various AI models.
transformations_tab_description: Here you can define custom text transformations. When you press the configured hotkey with text selected, a menu with your defined captions will appear. Clicking a button will rephrase the selected text using the corresponding prompt. This feature uses the 'Shared API Settings' from the 'Rephrasing' tab.
systray_double_click_copy_checkbox: Enable double click on SysTray to copy transcript
